confirmed_facts: Kim Hyekyung visited the Anatolia Civilization Museum on 2025-11-24 (local time).
The museum houses approximately 190,000 artifacts, including the â€˜Mother Goddess Statueâ€™, a gold-plated dagger, and a Hittite sun disk.
Kim emphasized the importance of cultural heritage preservation cooperation between South Korea and Turkey.
South Korea and Turkey signed a Memorandum of Understanding on cultural heritage and museum cooperation in 2013.
The Anatolia Museum expressed gratitude for Kimâ€™s visit and expects expanded exchanges with the National Museum of Korea.
Kim brought a souvenir â€˜Mu:DSâ€™ from the National Museum of Korea, symbolizing the desire for joint exhibitions and academic collaboration.

timeline.event: South Korea and Turkey signed a Memorandum of Understanding on cultural heritage and museum cooperation.
Kim Hyekyung visited the Anatolia Civilization Museum in Ankara.
